definitions.definition: To make (someone) aware of (something impending); especially:

subdefinitions.definition: To make (someone) aware of impending danger , evil , etc.
examples: We waved a flag to warn the oncoming traffic about the accident.
I phoned to warn him of the road closure.

subdefinitions.definition: To notify or inform (someone, about something).
examples: I warned him he'd be getting a huge box of birthday presents from me.

subdefinitions.definition: To summon (someone) to or inform of a formal meeting or duty .
To make a sound (e.g. clicking or whirring) indicating that it is about to strike or chime (an hour).
subdefinitions.label_groups: ambitransitive , of a clock , possibly obsolete

definitions.definition: To caution or admonish (someone) against unwise or unacceptable behaviour.
examples: He was warned against crossing the railway tracks at night.
Don't let me catch you running in the corridor again, I warn you.

definitions.definition: To advise or order to go or stay away .
examples: A sign warns trespassers off/away from the site.

main_definition: ( transitive ) To make (someone) aware of (something impending); especially:
secondary_definitions: ( transitive ) To caution or admonish (someone) against unwise or unacceptable behaviour. [from 11th c.]
( chiefly with "off", "away", and similar words ) To advise or order to go or stay away .
